message: Our police officers risk their lives every day to protect our communities and keep us safe. On Law Enforcement Appreciation Day I have lit up my office in blue to honor the men and women in blue who bravely serve and remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice in the line of duty. Today, and every day, we should ask ourselves what steps we can take to ensure every police officer returns home safely to their family at the end of every shift.

After eight years of the Obama Administration making it more difficult and costly to build infrastructure projects it’s long past time that we relieve the burden the federal government places on critical investments in infrastructure. That's why I have introduced the Reducing Environmental Barriers to Unified Infrastructure and Land Development (REBUILD) Act, H.R. 481, to cut red tape and reduce costs for infrastructure projects. The REBUILD Act reduces the cost and time necessary to build infrastructure projects at a time when communities are struggling to find the resources necessary to construct them.

Today the House took an important first step towards providing hard working American families with the relief they have been desperately seeking from the negative impacts of Obamacare. Republicans in Congress and President-Elect Trump are on a rescue mission to repeal Obamacare and replace it with healthcare that puts patients first and gives families more options. I look forward to working with my colleagues throughout this process to develop policies that will translate into the healthcare solutions my constituents need and deserve.

Our veterans should be able to use the education benefits they have earned without any unnecessary delays. These men and women have sacrificed so much for our country, I'm grateful I was able to get this bill signed into law and take a modest step in making their lives easier.

Honored to be presented with Eastern Municipal Water District’s 2016 Water Champion Award. Meeting California’s water challenges is a complex puzzle that requires dedication and hard work from many people and organizations. I’m proud of the contributions I have made over the years to advance water solutions. Eastern Municipal Water District has long been an invaluable partner in my efforts.  I’m grateful for their recognition and I look forward to our continued work together to provide Californians with an affordable and reliable water supply.

I want to congratulate President Trump on being sworn into office and welcome the entire Trump family to the White House. The coming weeks, months and years ahead will be filled with tremendous opportunities and challenges for President Trump.  I pray he finds the guidance, strength and conviction necessary to do what’s best for our country.  By electing President Trump, American voters chose to take our country in a different direction. Now, it’s time to roll up our sleeves and fulfill the promises that were made on the campaign trail. I am eager to make a meaningful contribution in the next chapter of our American democracy along with President Trump and help form a more perfect union.

The high rate of mail theft in our region, particularly the theft of cluster box units, is a serious concern that must be addressed. Today I introduced the Ensuring the Safety Our Mail Act, H.R. 603, which will double the maximum jail sentence for anyone convicted of mail theft. Clearly, the criminals breaking into these mailboxes are not afraid of the consequences. I believe we need to send a strong message that if you get caught stealing mail, you are going to do serious jail time. Families should have confidence that sensitive documents in their mailbox are safe.

President Trump is making good on the promises he made to the American people to secure our borders, deport criminal illegal immigrants, and put the security and sovereignty of our country first.  I commend his actions and fully support him.  If California cities and counties want to harbor criminal illegal immigrants, they are soon going to realize that their negligence towards public safety is now going to come with a very high price tag.

I believe Neil Gorsuch is a strong choice to serve on our Supreme Court.  Judge Gorsuch’s record indicates he will be a strong defender of the Constitution and American liberties. Judge Gorsuch is well qualified and was approved unanimously via voice vote for his current seat on the U. S. Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit. I applaud Senate Republicans for making sure that Justice Scalia’s seat on the Supreme Court was not filled during a contentious election by a lame-duck president, and ensuring the new justice was chosen by the president elected by American voters in our recent election. I’m hopeful that the Senate will act quickly to consider and confirm the nomination of Neil Gorsuch.

Last year, I worked with my California colleagues to pass bipartisan water legislation that was signed into law. Thanks to the passage of the WIIN Act, California will be able to pump and use more of this precipitation.

Throughout my time serving in the House I have played a key role in the efforts to replace wasteful government animal tests with modern alternative tests that save significant time, taxpayers’ money and animals’ lives. That's why, today, I introduced the FACT Act to ensure that Congress has the information necessary to determine if federal agencies are meeting their mandates to replace expensive and unnecessary animal testing whenever possible, because evidence suggests they are not. We need to protect taxpayers and animals wherever possible.

“I think the word ‘boondoggle’ was invented just to describe California’s high-speed rail project,” said Rep. Ken Calvert, R-Corona, who represents parts of the Inland Empire. “We should not spend another tax dollar on the high-speed rail project – period. Projects like the expansion of Interstate 15 in Riverside County and fixing other congested roads are a much better use of our limited infrastructure dollars.”

My office was happy to help a neighborhood in Menifee that just received a replacement box from the Postal Service after their box had been vandalized.  Mail theft in our region continues to be a major problem. That’s why I’ve introduced legislation to double the jail penalties for criminals who commit these acts.  In addition, my office stands ready to assist any affected individuals and neighborhoods to coordinate with the U.S. Postal Service to help restore mail service after a box is damaged.

Enjoyed talking about the many changes taking place in Washington over the past few weeks with the Corona Rotary at lunch today. As a past President of the Corona Rotary it's always nice to see such a great Rotarian turnout.
Enjoyed celebrating our local job creators at the Lake Elsinore Chamber of Commerce Installation and Awards dinner tonight.

I strongly support deporting illegal immigrants with felony convictions for violent offenses, including child sex crimes and assault. There are many challenging aspects to fixing our broken immigration system, but deporting violent criminals who are in our country illegally should be something all Americans who value our safety should support.

Today, I visited the Hap Arnold Innovation Center at March Air Reserve Base. We had a good discussion about how our private sector innovators are partnering with the Defense Dept. to put the latest technology to use to keep our soldiers safe and complete their mission.
Just wrapped up a productive meeting with our Riverside County officials discussing health care reform, local/federal immigration enforcement coordination, and infrastructure.
Just finished a good meeting speaking with the Menifee City Council about their federal priorities and hearing from a number of Menifee residents.

Today, I met with Lake Elsinore Mayor Bob Magee and Mayor Pro Tem Natasha Johnson to discuss the infrastructure needs in the city as well as the exciting economic development opportunities that exist. I look forward to our continued work together.

Earlier this week, I met with Canyon Lake Mayor Dawn Haggerty and Mayor Pro Tem Vicki Warren to discuss the potential purchase of excess federal land adjacent to the city and finding ways to improve the long-term water quality of the lake. I look forward to my continued work together with the city.

It was great to see so many people enjoying the Corona-Norco Family YMCA's 3rd Annual Fire and Ice Chili Cook-Off. I'm incredibly proud to join our community in supporting the fine work everyone at the YMCA does on behalf of our children.

On Friday, I met with Corona Mayor Dick Haley, Vice Mayor Karen Spiegel, and city staff regarding federal funding for infrastructure, finding federal grants for new senior/community centers, and economic development opportunities. I look forward to my continued work with my hometown.

Last week I met with Eastvale Council Member Todd Rigby and city staff to discuss the construction of an expanded Hamner bridge, the improvement of the Limonite/I-15 interchange, and my legislation to establish a single zip code for the city.

As the Chairman of the Interior & Environment Appropriations Subcommittee, I am responsible for working with my colleagues to ensure agencies like the National Park Service and Smithsonian have the funding necessary to maintain their properties. Today, I led a bipartisan visit and briefing to examine the necessary maintenance at some of our most visited sites along the National Mall.  I want to make sure Americans have the opportunity to explore these extraordinary places now and well into the future.

I recently met with Murrieta Mayor Rick Gibbs and Council Member Randon Lane to discuss the Keller Road/I-215 interchange project, the Murrieta Creek flood control project, and mail theft. I'm eager to continue working with these and other constituents from the city to address Murrieta's opportunities and challenges.

The Interior Appropriations Subcommittee's Members’ Day was an excellent opportunity to include the voices of all Members of the House in shaping our future Interior Appropriations bill. The testimonies given by my fellow colleagues in the House, including California Congressman Doug LaMalfa, reflected my concern for the careful consideration and direction of each and every tax dollar that my subcommittee will manage. I'm grateful Interior Ranking Member Rep. Betty McCollum (D-MN-4) and Rep. Mike Simpson (R-ID-2) participated as well.

Tonight, President Trump laid out a bold agenda to get America back on the right track.  I look forward to working with him to enact it. Here’s my full statement on tonight’s #JointAddress: goo.gl/ve0DdG
It’s a beautiful day outside in Washington D.C. I think our office dog, Cali, is ready to go play outside. Happy #WienerDogWednesday!

I am honored to be named as the Vice Chairman of the Defense Appropriations Subcommittee. Conducting hearings, reviewing the President’s budget request and crafting the bill that funds our men and women in uniform is of the highest importance.  As we face numerous threats around the world it is vital that we provide our Armed Forces with the resources they need to accomplish their missions and minimize risk as well as plan for future threats.

I had the honor of speaking at the Building Industry Association of Riverside County's Legislative Affairs Committee Luncheon to discuss the steps I’m taking in Washington to help grow our economy. Topics included President Trump’s infrastructure plan, regulatory reform and tax reform. I look forward to working with our job creators to kick our economic engine into high gear.

Today, President Trump signed a revised Executive Order that will ensure the continued security and protection of the American homeland. As the President clearly stated in his Joint Session address to Congress last week, “we cannot allow a beachhead of terrorism to form inside America.” The new Executive Order will allow time for our government to properly vet individuals from countries that are terrorist hotbeds and whose governments do not have sustainable investigation procedures.

With premiums rising, deductibles increasing, and health care choices decreasing, American families know all too well that Obamacare is collapsing. That’s exactly why I promised the voters in my district that I would take action and work to repeal and replace Obamacare with patient-centered health care solutions that actually reduce costs and expand choices. The simple fact is our health care system is on life support and whoever won last year’s election was going to need to resuscitate it. The introduction of the American Health Care Act is an important step towards the fulfillment of that promise. Read my full statement about the bill here: https://goo.gl/FkuF8k

I just voted to give our troops a much deserved pay raise. The Defense Appropriations bill passed by the House today is an important first step to rebuild and restore our military strength. Read my full statement here: goo.gl/0JXjy6
Just another day at the office for Cali and her crew in the halls of Congress.

I want to thank Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly for making an immediate impact on securing our borders. Gaining control of our borders is a critical element to our national security and an effective immigration system. There's more work to do, but this is a good start.
Great news for Riverside County drivers!

Flashback: CBO projected 24 million people insured under #Obamacare in 2017.  It is half that. #RepealandReplace http://energycommerce.house.gov/sites/republicans.energycommerce.house.gov/files/documents/CBOEnrollmentProjections.jpg
#TBT to Cali’s first day in the office over 9 years ago! Time flies when you have a good dog by your side.

I wrote a law to improve legal immigration.  We are a proud nation of immigrants and honoring that path means differentiating between legal and illegal. https://www.congress.gov/bill/107th-congress/house-bill/1892
Tune in to my Facebook Live interview on Friday, March 31st with the Press Enterprise. Post questions and find details here:

I applaud the actions taken today by the Department of Justice because they rightfully indicate that protecting American families should be our highest priority. As I’ve said before, it’s completely irresponsible for any government to willfully shield criminal illegal immigrants from federal immigration officials. Like many Americans, I disagree with cities that place protecting criminal illegal immigrants ahead of the safety of our families.

Earlier today I met with Colonel Kirk Gibbs and staff from the Army Corps of Engineers Los Angeles District to discuss progress on the Murrieta Creek flood control project, as well as other important projects in our region. I'm committed to working with our cities, Riverside County, and the Corps to find the resources necessary to keep these important projects moving.

Had a great meeting today with Eastern Municipal Water District Director Ron Sullivan and staff to talk about the water challenges in Riverside County. I look forward to continue working with them to ensure our residents have access to a reliable and affordable water supply.

Join me for a Telephone Town Hall Meeting on Tuesday, April 4th at 6:00 p.m. PST. During the Telephone Town Hall, I will provide an update on what’s happening in Congress and take questions from constituents live on the call. To sign-up and participate in the call click the link below and enter your phone number.  You'll then receive a call next Tuesday, April 4th around 6:00 p.m. PST to join the call. You can also submit questions below in the comments.

I want to applaud our Riverside County Sheriffs who apprehended these mail thieves. Mail theft continues to be a widespread problem that disrupts the lives of its victims. California's early release policies are dangerously placing far too many criminals on the street. We should be enhancing the penalties for mail theft, that's why I have introduced a bill (H.R.603) to double the jail time for convicted mail thieves.

This story highlights why Congress needs to pass my bipartisan FACT Act (H.R.816) legislation which will increase transparency in taxpayer-funded animal testing. If we can protect animals while protecting taxpayers it's a win-win.
I hope you can join us tomorrow morning for this live interview!

Today’s event commemorating the opening of the 91 Freeway project is a symbolic reminder that we can think big and build big if we all work together to tackle the challenges we face in our region. Thanks to everyone who helped make this project a reality and for the patience of commuters who felt the growing pains. There’s more work to do but this is a big step in the right direction.
I hope you can join us tomorrow night!
Please join me this month to #LightItUpBlue with @AutismSpeaks for the millions impacted by #autism worldwide. #Congress4LIUB

The military strikes ordered by President Trump were an appropriate and measured response to the horrific chemical weapons attack by the Assad regime on Syrian civilians, including children.  Unlike the previous administration, President Trump has now made it clear by his actions that the use of chemical weapons to brutally murder innocent people will not be allowed to continue without consequences. The entire civilized world has a clear and compelling interest to uphold this principle.  Congress must work closely with President Trump, Defense Secretary James Mattis, and our other national security officials to further develop and implement a strategy to confront the many challenges in Syria, as well as the actions by Russia, Iran, and other nations that have aided the Assad regime in its unacceptable behavior. I am hopeful that President Trump’s strong leadership and decisive actions will send a clear signal to dangerous regime’s across the globe that the days of meaningless ‘red lines’ and phony international agreements are over.

Sanctuary city policies make it harder to detain and deport dangerous criminal illegal immigrants, like MS-13 gang members. These gang members have terrorized far too many Hispanic American and other communities. We must stop them.

I had the privilege of touring the Comprehensive Autism Center in Temecula this morning. They do tremendous and compassionate work, including serving many military families with autistic children. I have and I will continue to ensure TRICARE and other programs help families get access to this life changing care. #autismawareness #autism #autismawarenessmonth

First grade students at Santa Rosa Academy in Menifee recently invited me to visit them in their classroom. Today, I was fortunate enough to pay them a visit and get a tour of their school, which is a public charter school grades K-12.  The teachers and staff at the school are doing truly extraordinary work and with the school's waitlist being around 3,500 students I think it's safe to say parents in the area agree. The school is yet another example of the tremendous educational opportunities dedicated members of our community are providing our children.
Thank you for inviting me! There are a lot of exciting things happening at Santa Rosa Academy!
NA
Thank you Sgt. First Class Barrientos for your service to our country!

I fully support protecting extraordinary public lands so Americans can admire their beauty and have access to recreational opportunities. Unfortunately, the Antiquities Act has been used far too often by past administrations to block off huge swaths of land for political purposes, ignoring the input of local citizens.  That’s why I support the executive actions being taken today.

Our office is starting to receive entries for the Annual Congressional Art Competition! If you are a high school student residing in the 42nd Congressional District there is still time to submit an entry. The deadline is next Thursday, May 4th. More info here: https://goo.gl/JK2OuA
Thank you to my four incredible interns who have been invaluable to my office over the last five months. Best of luck in your future endeavors!

Join my staff tomorrow night at our Annual Academy Night event for high school students in the 42nd Congressional District who are interested in attending one of the U.S. military academies. The event is from 6:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. at Ortega High School Conference Center which is located at 520 Chaney Street in Lake Elsinore. Read more information here: https://goo.gl/8zuQn2
Great meeting with the 8th grade students of Linfield Christian School from Temecula today on the U.S. Capitol steps.

The funding bill approved today funds a number of important priorities for the country, California and the Inland Empire. As Chairman of the Interior Subcommittee, I’m especially pleased that we were able to fund increases in programs like the Diesel Emission Reduction Program, which clean our air by leveraging modest federal investments with state and private dollars. The bill also provides critical increases in resources for our military to improve readiness and training. I’m especially pleased that the bill provides our troops with a much deserved 2.1 percent pay raise for the military, instead of 1.6 percent that had been requested by former President Obama.  Make no mistake, this is not a bill that Nancy Pelosi would have written.  In total, the bill includes a $1.5 billion increase in funding for border security, including more agents and tools to stop illegal activity. Combined with the Trump administration’s elimination of the misguided ‘catch and release’ policy, this funding will help further curtail the flow of illegal immigration across our borders. We also rejected calls to increase the D.C. bureaucracy at agencies like the EPA, which we hold to its lowest staffing level since 1989, and prohibit a number of job-killing regulations. Read more here: https://goo.gl/TDznyD

As we saw just this week in Iowa, Obamacare is collapsing and something must be done to protect Americans. Today the House took action to fix our broken health care system. My vote for the American Health Care Act fulfills a promise I made to voters to save them from the harmful effects far too many of them have experienced since Obamacare was enacted into law. The American Health Care Act lays the groundwork for delivering the health care system Americans deserve by dismantling one-size-fits-all Obamacare and puts in its place policies that will create sustainable, market-driven, patient-focused health care options. Don’t be misled, the American Health Care Act does NOT remove pre-existing condition protections. I encourage you to read more about the bill here: https://goo.gl/wxJFhP

@NRO does a great job of breaking down how the AHCA treats pre-existing conditions: “no one is left out in the cold” http://www.nationalreview.com/article/447430/ahca-pre-existing-conditions-big-lie-democrats-are-telling
I had a great time speaking to the Corona/Norco Republican Women last night!  We covered a lot of issues and they had great questions regarding border security, taxes and trade.
Every minute, every hour, every day, moms make contributions that shape our lives and our world. Thank you! Happy Mother's Day!

On Peace Officers Memorial Day we remember and honor those who sacrificed everything to keep our communities safe. This week the House will vote on several bills aimed at providing law enforcement the tools they need to help carry out their difficult jobs. These include the Strengthening State and Local Cyber Crime Fighting Act of 2017 (H.R. 1616), introduced by Rep. John Ratcliffe (R-TX), and the Probation Officer Protection Act of 2017 (H.R. 1039), introduced by Rep. Dave Reichert (R-WA). I have and I will always support our men and women in blue. #NationalPoliceWeek

As I’ve stated before, I believe in following the facts of the investigation, and there are several investigations looking into Russian meddling into the election. These investigations are not on a timeline, they will go where the facts lead.  I strongly support the oversight power of Congress which is currently being summoned for the accusations regarding the firing of James Comey and intelligence leaks to Russia.  I understand that people want answers now but a rush to judgment serves no purpose.  I also remain deeply troubled about the leaks from the Intelligence Community. There is a chain of command in these situations and it does not involve leaking information to the media.

The Washington Post is not exactly known as a conservative paper, yet, they just found another Democrat claim about the American Health Care Act to be false. Specifically, the Post calls Democrats claim that ‘7 million veterans will lose their tax credit’ under the GOP health bill FALSE.  The AHCA does NOT deny veterans tax credits. Democrats in Washington should stop trying to mislead and scare our veterans.

The freedoms and liberties all Americans enjoy are dependent upon the willingness of our fellow citizens to step forward and lay everything on the line to defend them. This Memorial Day we remember the Americans who sacrificed everything in order to secure the values we hold dear.  Our community pays a special honor to the American heroes we remember today who called the Inland Empire home.  Words fail to adequately express our appreciation and gratitude.
Some significant federal resources are heading towards important Riverside County projects. There’s more work to accomplish in the years ahead, but this is certainly welcome news.

Today, I attended the ribbon-cutting of the new Joint Regional Deployment Processing Center at March Air Reserve Base. When our troops are deploying to the far corners of the world they should have the comfort and security of a modern deployment facility. This project also marks another step in modernizing March and investing in its future as a very active military installation.

Seventy-three years ago today, brave Americans stormed distant beaches across the Atlantic to defend the cause of liberty. Below you can read the words, then, General Dwight D. Eisenhower delivered to soldiers before they hit the shores in Normandy. Seventy-three years later, we remember and stand in awe of the “great and noble undertaking” of these great Americans. #DDay

The Prado Dam Bicentennial Mural has been a source of patriotism and pride for our region since it was painted. As I’ve stated for some time, I believe the mural should be repainted as it was originally designed with a long-term plan put in place to ensure its properly maintained. I will continue to advocate for this outcome.
Rep. Calvert Announces Military Service Academy Appointments

I just voted for bipartisan legislation to protect veterans and hold government employees accountable. Fulfilling our promise to care for America’s veterans is one of my highest priorities in Congress. In far too many instances the VA has failed to uphold the standards of care and treatment that our veterans deserve.  While there are many, many hard working and dedicated individuals at the VA, those who have fallen short must go – period. With the passage of this bill we take an important step towards ending a culture within the VA bureaucracy that is more committed to protecting itself than protecting the welfare of our veterans. Read more about the bill here: goo.gl/2ygSw9

My thoughts and prayers are with my colleague Congressman Steve Scalise and the other victims of this morning’s horrible shooting. The brave and selfless actions of the Capitol Police officers saved countless lives. I pray these heroes will recover quickly from their injuries. I also want to express my appreciation for the quick response by the Alexandria police and paramedics, as well as those at the scene.  Any attack on members of Congress is an attack on our democracy. The United States Congress is the finest legislative body in the world and its members will not be intimidated or cower in the face of threats of violence. All members, Republicans and Democrats, stand together in condemning this act of violence.   Americans have a fundamental right to express their opinions, but committing acts of violence against elected officials is never acceptable. While I think most Americans understand that, we should have an even higher goal for our political discourse. I have always believed that we can disagree without being disagreeable. Let us take pause and remember that we are all united by our love for this country and all of the values that it stands for.
On a very difficult day in our nation’s capital, the House Chaplain, Father Pat Conroy, offered these words of prayer.

The desire to breathe clean air is not a conservative or a liberal ideal, it’s a basic health necessity. That’s why Republicans and Democrats have supported EPA programs, like the Clean Diesel program, that have played a major role in getting older, dirtier vehicles off our roads. At a hearing this morning, I let EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt know how important the Clean Diesel program is to our region because we all want to breathe clean air.

Today I voted for legislation that provides critical resources for our activity duty military as well as our veterans.  The bill included $15 million for a new Remote Piloted Aircraft Flight Training Unit facility at March Air Reserve Base. The demand for of Remote Piloted Aircraft by our military will continue to grow, so this investment is essential to making sure March can meet the future needs of our Air Force. The bill approved today also helps meet our promise to our nation’s veterans, who deserve nothing less than first class care and treatment by the VA. You can read more about the bill here: https://goo.gl/k7hhtS

Like all natural disasters, earthquakes don’t discriminate between Republicans and Democrats. Just a few seconds warning before a major earthquake can save countless lives. That’s why I’m leading the bipartisan effort in Congress to fund and develop a fully functional earthquake early warning system.

Tougher accountability at the VA. Expanding career and technical education opportunities. Reining in Washington and repealing Obama-era regulations. Increased national security funding. Those are just some of the solutions that we’ve advanced in Congress so far this year. This week in the House we’re passing legislation to enhance the enforcement of our immigration laws. We’re making progress, but a lot of work remains ahead.

Tomorrow, the House will vote on two bills that reinforce our immigration laws: The No Sanctuary for Criminals Act (H.R. 3003) which strengthens the law to combat dangerous sanctuary policies, and Kate’s Law (H.R. 3004) which enhances penalties for deported felons who return to the United States. I’m a cosponsor of both bills because I strongly believe that we must restore the rule of law and take responsible steps to protect Americans. Fixing our broken immigration system is complicated, but we should all support the deportation of illegal immigrants who have committed violent crimes. We should continue America’s proud tradition of welcoming legal immigrants who want to work and make the U.S. a better place – but we should give criminal illegal immigrants a one-way ticket back home.

The House just passed two bills I've cosponsored that bolster our immigration laws. The No Sanctuary for Criminals Act (H.R. 3003), which strengthens the law to combat dangerous sanctuary policies, was approved by a vote of 228 to 195. Kate’s Law (H.R. 3004), which enhances penalties for deported felons who return to the United States, was approved by a vote of 257 to 167. additional crimes once they are here is a clear threat to our safety and should be deported. Unlike the actions being taken by Democrats in Sacramento, Republicans in Washington are passing bills that give our law enforcement community additional tools and put the well-being of legal residents first and foremost.You can read more about the bills here: https://goo.gl/dZbSE8
I was proud to support and advance this important funding bill for our troops yesterday.
Happy Independence Day! As you celebrate today remember those who secured our independence and who have defended it ever since.

Iraqi and U.S.-led coalition forces have dealt a major blow to ISIS in Mosul. The so-called ISIS caliphate has fallen and forces representing the civilized world are on the march. ISIS’s hateful, violent beliefs will find no sanctuary.

Good news for those of us here in earthquake country! As the chairman of the subcommittee that's responsible for funding this program, I want to make sure we continue the momentum we have in developing this important system. Just a few seconds warning can stop trains, critical systems, and save lives.
I just delivered remarks on the floor of the House of Representatives in support of H.R. 23, the GROW Act. The bill contains a number of provisions aimed at improving California’s water reliability.

The growth of so-called birth tourism in southern California, including Eastvale, has resulted in a number of raids and arrests over the past few years. While we continue to welcome people to our country through legal means, it’s critical that we crack down on individuals who fraudulently come to America for the sole purpose of obtaining U.S. citizenship for their child. I advocated for report language that was included in the Homeland Security funding bill that I’m certain will draw the attention of Homeland Security officials to this problem. https://goo.gl/Q4jviC

Earlier today the House Veterans Affairs Committee passed H.R. 3218, comprehensive legislation to improve and extend GI Bill benefits granted to veterans. I’m happy to report the bill contains the legislative text of H.R. 925, which I introduced earlier this year in response to a constituent and Air Force Reservist who approached me with the problem. The important reform included in this bill will provide a common sense fix to the Post 9/11 GI Bill benefits our reservists receive. Our veterans and reservists should have the peace-of-mind of knowing that they can obtain the benefits they have earned without complications. You can find more information about this legislation here: https://goo.gl/pMzWfu

Our greatest responsibility as Members of Congress is to provide the resources necessary to the men and women of our Armed Forces. We are at crossroads.  Right now, our military continues to operate at a high-tempo to carry out the national security interests of the U.S.  However, in order to meet the next challenge – whatever that may be – we must invest now. That's why I delivered remarks on the floor of the House today in support of H.R. 3219, the Make America Secure Appropriations Act.
If you have a citrus tree, it’s critical that you regularly inspect them for psyllids. Get more information at www.californiacitrusthreat.org

I had the pleasure of attending the annual "State of the Command" briefing at the Naval Surface Warfare Center Corona. Capt. Steve Murray updated local businesses and government leaders on the increased demand for Corona's independent assessment, metrology/calibration and range systems engineering expertise - and showcased several projects on the horizon.

It’s always great to see and spend time with my fellow Rotarians. Today, the Corona Rotary proudly distributed the proceeds from their annual Lobsterfest fundraiser to non-profit community organizations. Thank you to everyone who supports this and other great causes in our community!

Today I visited and received a briefing from CalTech and USGS about the ShakeAlert earthquake early warning system. I've supported funding for this important program because just a few seconds of warning can save countless lives.
I spent the morning talking to local Realtors about housing, tax reform and our economy.
Enjoyed speaking with the Corona Lions Club at lunch today. Lots of good questions and discussion about the opportunities and challenges facing our country.

Earlier today I held a Job Creator Listening Session on Tax Reform. Small business representatives and local leaders from throughout the 42nd District shared ideas and discussed tax reform. We need a tax code that allows our small businesses to succeed, grow and fuel economic growth. Today, our job creators made it clear that they share our goal of reforming our tax code to make American companies more competitive globally. Any changes to our tax code must also take into account the important role non-profit organizations play in our communities. I plan on taking that message back to Washington and advocating for pro-growth tax policies that will truly help our economy.

I spoke today at a press conference announcing the introduction of the Legal Workforce Act. The bill will preserve jobs for citizens and legal workers by requiring U.S. employers to check the work eligibility of all future hires through the E-Verify system. When I introduced the legislation that originally created E-Verify as a voluntary program, I wanted to give employers a free, easy-to-use tool to make sure they were following the law. Making the use of E-Verify mandatory is good for our employers as well as for American workers and anyone legally authorized to work in our country.

Today, I joined with Congressman Lamar Smith (TX-21) and House Judiciary Committee Chairman Bob Goodlatte (VA-6) to introduce the Legal Workforce Act (H.R. 3711) to preserve jobs for citizens and legal workers by requiring U.S. employers to check the work eligibility of all future hires through the E-Verify system. Mandatory E-Verify is long overdue. The program is ready to go mandatory and the Legal Workforce Act will deliver on the promise to ensure that American jobs go to American workers and those authorized to work in the U.S.

We will never forget those who died on September 11, 2001, those who acted bravely in the face of danger, and the love we share for our fellow Americans.  The actions taken by the passengers on Flight 93 as well as the first responders in New York and at the Pentagon highlighted the proud tradition of Americans standing together in the face of adversity. In the past few weeks we’ve seen that same spirit in the wake of Hurricanes Harvey and Irma.  We are forever grateful for those Americans who serve, care and protect us in our times of need.

I recently sent a letter urging the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to deny Nevada Hydro’s request to waive pre-filing licensing requirements for its proposed Lake Elsinore Advanced Pumped Storage (LEAPS) Project due to significant local concerns with the project. I have heard from many of my constituents and the city of Lake Elsinore regarding their concerns with the LEAPS Project. FERC should deny any attempt to fast-track the project and take into account the many questions and complicated issues surrounding the LEAPS Project. The region around Lake Elsinore has changed dramatically since Nevada Hydro first submitted its environmental documents and original application in 2007. The outdated documents and significant community concerns make it vital that FERC deny the waiver request and follow a deliberative process that fully scrutinizes the project.

I spoke with reporter Hal Eisner today about the importance of developing the West Coast earthquake early warning system in the aftermath of the tragic earthquake in Mexico. Watch on Fox 11 this afternoon.
Mexico’s earthquake warning system undoubtedly saved lives. That’s why I will keep advocating for the completion of the West Coast system. Watch my interview with Fox 11 about this important program.
Read my op-ed in the Press Enterprise about fixing our broken immigration system by restoring the rule of law. Let’s get back to enacting and enforcing the laws as our Founders envisioned.

The tax reform framework announced today is an important step towards making America’s tax code fairer, simpler and more competitive. We need a tax code that works for the middle-class and for our job creators. By putting America first we can create more economic opportunities that will benefit hard-working families throughout our country. Read more about the framework here: https://goo.gl/Gpcu8D

If you’ve been to my Washington, D.C. office you know that the real star in the office is Cali, our office dog. Cali is nominated for the Cutest Pets on the Hill contest and in our unbiased opinion deserves your vote. Click here to vote: www.healthyanimals.org/voting-2017
Our prayers were answered and today we welcomed our colleague Congressman Steve Scalise back to the House.

This morning I talked to Corona job creators about our tax reform framework. By putting America first we can create more economic opportunities that will benefit hard-working families throughout our country. Thanks Corona Chamber of Commerce for hosting a great event!

I have long been a strong supporter of Second Amendment rights and I will never waiver from that commitment.  However, it is incumbent on all of us to reflect on our current gun laws and seek to better protect ourselves and each other.  There are steps that both the Executive and the Congress can take to protect innocent Americans from an attack such as Las Vegas.  There is simply no reason for someone to be able to modify a legal weapon to shoot like a machine gun.  Bump stocks should never have been made legal and we must act quickly to ban them.  I have agreed to sign a letter urging the ATF to reverse their 2010 ruling that allowed the sale of bump stocks and I am working with a number of Republicans and Democrats on a potential legislative solution as well.    Protecting the rights of law-abiding American citizens while providing for the safety of our communities are not mutually exclusive goals.

Like many Californians, I think Democrats in Sacramento have made a tremendous mistake by enacting legislation making California a sanctuary state. Creating roadblocks instead of coordination between law enforcement agencies makes our communities less safe and places our law enforcement officers in greater danger. I’m hopeful the courts will side with those trying to enforce the rule of law and protect American families.

I'll be holding a Telephone Town Hall meeting on Thursday, October 19th, 2017 at 6:00 p.m. PST. I’m looking forward to hearing from you and answering your questions. You can register for the call here: https://goo.gl/yiLxm2

Today, I voted for emergency funding for hurricane and wildfire relief and recovery. Over the past few months, Americans have faced the devastating effects of significant hurricanes and wildfires. The passage of this emergency funding is critical to everyone impacted by these disasters and our heroes who respond to them. Tremendous challenges remain for many Americans but we will stand together in support of them throughout the recovery process.

Read my op-ed in the The Hill on why the decision by President Trump to remove the US from UNESCO sends a strong message to the world that anyone with an anti-Israel and anti-Semitic agenda will not go unchallenged.

Last week, I had the honor of visiting the Patriotic Dog Foundation in Murrieta, which provides highly trained service dogs to many veterans with special physical and emotional needs. Tom Tackett and the rest of his team are doing extraordinary work for our veterans. How great are these dogs?
This Saturday you can clean out your medicine cabinet and safely dispose of expired or other prescription drugs you no longer need. Locations throughout Riverside County.

Veterans - the Library of Congress wants to hear your story! On Saturday, November 4th, volunteers for the Veterans History Project will be interviewing veterans at the Amber Waves of Grain Festival right here in Corona so that their stories can be archived for future generations. All U.S. veterans can participate. Request an appointment by emailing ahub@loc.gov. Feel free to urge your loved ones who have proudly served this country to share their story!

I am very encouraged that the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act will help us deliver the tax reform and relief that middle-income taxpayers and our job creators so desperately need. Lowering rates, doubling the standard deduction, and increasing the child tax credit are great steps that will allow working families to keep more of the money they earn. In its current form the bill maintains a deduction for state and local property taxes, as well as the mortgage interest deduction. I will be working with my California colleagues as this bill moves through Congress to ensure the final bill adequately provides relief to middle class taxpayers in my congressional district. At the end of the day, I am confident that we will enact tax reform that grows our economy, wages, jobs and is a big boost for American families. Click here for a summary of the bill and the bill text: https://goo.gl/VKp1yf
Happy Birthday, Marines!
Our freedoms have and continue to be secured by the sacrifices of those who serve in our military. A grateful nation thanks all of our veterans.

I believe American jobs should only go to people who are legally authorized to work. Don’t believe the misleading information from the open-borders crowd. E-Verify works. That’s why I’m supporting a bill to make its use mandatory.

Keeping America safe is my top priority in Congress and providing the tools and training for our extraordinary men and women in uniform is critical to achieving that goal. The bill approved today gives our troops the highest pay raise they’ve seen in the past eight years. The bill also takes significant steps to address the long-running training and readiness challenges our military has faced over the past number of years.

I voted for the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act because it allows my constituents in the 42nd District to keep more of the money they earn and will produce tremendous economic benefits that help working families. Despite the misinformed and misleading claims from tax-loving liberals, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act produces real tax relief – especially for low-income and middle-income households with children. That’s not my opinion, that’s math. This tax bill will allow a majority of my constituents to opt for an increased standard deduction and, on average, boost after-tax income for middle-class families in California by $2,932.

Today, California has over 50,000 children in our foster care system. Many of these children and youth are available for adoption and waiting to be part of a loving family. Join me in celebrating National Adoption Day today! www.natladoptionday.org #natladoptionday #adoptiongives

Wishing you and your family a Happy Thanksgiving! Please take a moment to give thanks to those who are unable to join their families today because they are deployed around the world to protect us and the liberties we are so grateful for today and every day.
This is a critical project for the Air National Guard and March Air Reserve Base that I will continue to support.

Kate Steinle’s family has suffered an agonizing loss and now have been denied justice for the man who shot and killed her. If our immigration laws were enforced, Kate would be alive today. I defy anyone to defend that murderer’s right to be on the San Francisco pier the night he took her life.

As stated in my letter to FERC, I join a number of local residents, organizations and government agencies who have concerns with the due diligence and analysis of the various impacts associated with the LEAPS project. FERC must take a closer look at these impacts to our region. Thanks to everyone in the “We Are Temescal Valley” and other Facebook communities for their important engagement on this issue.
New figures show fewer people are attempting to illegally cross our border because we are restoring the rule of law. We must continue to enforce our immigration laws.
Today we remember those who lost their lives at Pearl Harbor as well as the brave Americans who responded and defended the liberties we hold so dear.
Please follow all evacuation orders and warnings. Check on elderly and disabled residents in the area. Stay safe.

Earlier today I attended a bipartisan briefing at the White House with Vice President Mike Pence on the federal response to the California wildfires. Like all Californians, I’m incredibly grateful for all of the federal, state and local agencies that have responded to the wildfires.

The California National Guard deserves modern equipment to carry out its mission. Providing our Guard with these upgraded Blackhawks has been a high priority. In recent days, the Guard has utilized its Blackhawk fleet to help combat the California wildfires. With upgraded aircraft, the Guard will be in a better position to help California.

With the House passage of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act we are on the verge of enacting the most pro-growth tax policy our country has seen in decades. Lower taxes, more jobs, and higher wages are on the way. Congress listened to the concerns voiced about the original bill and we produced an even better bill.  I am confident that our economy is now poised for tremendous growth thanks to the passage of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. As soon as next month, Americans will see and feel the impact of this bill by having more money in their paychecks. Read more here: https://goo.gl/xfGaoK

The tax reform bill hasn’t even been signed into law yet and American job creators are already investing in their workforce. The American worker is the focal point of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. These investments demonstrate that job creators know their success is linked to the men and women who show up to work every day. Lower taxes, more jobs, and higher wages are on the way for America!

Taxes boil down to math, not political rhetoric. This CBS video highlights that point. The families interviewed believed the naysayers and didn’t expect much tax relief. In the end, the accountant points out “Every single one of those families will have more money in their pocket next year.”

I recently participated in the Red Cross annual Holiday Mail for Heroes event. The hundreds of cards they collected will be sent to our military service members stationed overseas for the holidays. Thanks to the Red Cross for their tireless support for our military families, and thanks to all who serve our nation. Merry Christmas! #HolidayMail #RedCross #HolidaysforHeroes
